author: ashithanagesh
title: Girl, 3, crushed by 100kg man who stood on her stomach
text:
Victoria Supreme Court in Melbourne (Picture: Rex) A 100kg man crushed a toddler to death when he stood on her stomach.
Seven months after her death it emerged that the killer had put his full weight on the three-year-old girl ‘in frustration’ after tripping over her while she was playing on the floor.
Man lost a bet so downed a litre of vodka in 40 seconds He then told the girl to go to bed, and to tell her mum that she just had a stomach ache.
Australia’s 9News reported that by midday the next day, the child had become pale and limp – and was tragically declared dead in hospital soon afterwards.
The 22-year-old man, who can’t be named for legal reasons, has now pleaded guilty to child homicide over the girl’s death in 2015.
The man is due to be sentenced on February 24 (Picture: Rex) Senior crown prosecutor Kerri Judd QC told the Victorian Supreme Court in Melbourne, Australia: ‘In frustration, he turned her around and stepped on her stomach with one foot.
‘He took his other foot off the ground, thereby putting his entire weight on her.’
Man shot dead after spray painting penis on car and firing at officers Psychologist Patrick Newton, who had treated the man, told the court that he kept quiet about his crime because ‘shame, guilt and fear had left him paralysed’.
The child’s mother was visibly grief-stricken during the hearing, and had to excuse herself from the court many times as the graphic details of the crime were revealed.
In her victim impact statement, read to the court, she said: ‘I was lied to for seven months when he knew the truth. I no longer trust anyone after being betrayed… like this.’
The girl’s biological father also said he suffered severe anxiety, and had lost 44kg since his daughter’s death.
The man is due to be sentenced on February 24.
